text: is a traditional name taken on by a series of tea masters of the Uranseke family.Sen, Sōshitsu. (1998). The Japanese Way of Tea: From Its Origins in China to Sen Rikyū, p. 231. ==Lineage== Sen Sōshitsu is the name of the head (iemoto) of one of the three schools of the Japanese tea ceremony ===List of Urasenke tea masters=== * Sen Rikyū (1522-1591) * Shōan Sōjun (1546-1614) * Genpaku Sōtan (1578-1658) * * * * * * * * * * * *Sen, p. 187. * ==References== ==Other websites== * Urasenke official home page Category:Japanese tea ceremony
title: Sen Sōshitsu
